_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: AssaultCube ( REQUIRES 2 CONSECUTIVE PORTS )
author: holeintheseat@gmail.com
description:
REQUIRES 2 CONSECUTIVE PORTS (DEFAULT PORTS: 28763 and 28764)
                                                                                  Game port ^        |        ^ Server Info Broadcast

AssaultCube is a FREE, multiplayer, first-person shooter game, based on the CUBE engine.

Taking place in realistic environments, with fast, arcade gameplay, it's addictive and fun!

With efficient bandwidth usage, it's low-latency and can even run over a 56 Kbps connection.
It's tiny too, weighing in at a lightweight about 50 MB package available for Windows, Mac and Linux.
On the correct settings, it can even run on old hardware (Pentium III and above).

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# AssaultCube Server Egg (By HoleInTheSeat) <|-|> (https://assault.cubers.net/)
#
# Server Files: /mnt/server
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server
#######-|Init|-#######
apt-get update -y
#######-|Dependencies|-#######
apt-get install -y tar make wget bzip2 build-essential clang libclang-dev libclang1 llvm llvm-dev clang-tools libz-dev
#######-|Downloading files|-#######
cd /mnt/server
wget https://github.com/assaultcube/AC/releases/download/v1.3.0.2/AssaultCube_v1.3.0.2_LockdownEdition_RC1.tar.bz2 -O - | tar -xj
#######-|Setting Up Server|-#######
cd
if [ "$(uname -m)" = "aarch64" ]; then
cd /mnt/server/source/src
make server_install
else
echo -e "x86 System" 
fi
#######-|Enable Execution|-#######
cd /mnt/server
chmod +x server_wizard.sh
chmod +x server.sh
#######-|Insert Server Authkey|-#######
cd /mnt/server
sed -i 's/AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA/{{ASSAULT_SERVER_KEY}}/' ./config/servercmdline.txt
#######-|Alert Completion|-#######
echo -e "####################"
echo -e "##Install Complete##"
echo -e "####################"

variables.name: Server Auth Key
variables.description:
With the 1.3 release servers (and players) have identity keys. You must provide your own key for the server to register on the masterserver. Without any key the server will be LAN only.

A key must be 64 characters long and may contain all hexadecimal characters 0-9 and a-f. To generate a key you can run the client and issue the command:

            authkey new server
          
The third argument is only a name given that key, use quotes if you want e.g. authkey new "server alpha three". You can then copy your key from the file config/authkeys.cfg - there are five lines (4 of which are comments) for your named authkey. The line which starts with '// priv ' or the one starting with 'authkey add ' contain the private key - do not include the name string. (https://assault.cubers.net/docs/server.html)

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: Set the limit on amount of players able to join (MAX 16)

variables.name: Player Password
variables.description: Password need to join the server.

variables.name: Master Server
variables.description:
Forces the server to register with the hostname or IP address of a different masterserver.
The default is ms.cubers.net
If you want your server to be hidden and not report to the masterserver, use -mlocalhost
